task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 2°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The current pitch is 0°, so the camera is level; to see the full height of the building, I need to look upward to capture the roofline.
I need to see the building's base to measure from ground level; looking down will align the camera to capture the full vertical span from base to roof.
Having adjusted pitch to view both the base (30° down) and roof (30° up), the total vertical angle spans ~60°. Assuming a typical distance of 10m to the building, height ≈ 10 * tan(60°) ≈ 17.3m.
